books.title: Lay Down Your Arms
books.author: Bertha von Suttner
books.summary: A woman relates how war has impacted her life and destroyed what she holds dear.

books.title: After London
books.author: Richard Jefferies
books.summary: A young man tries to understand his place in the world as he explores a post-apocalyptic England.

books.title: Up from Slavery
books.author: Booker T. Washington
books.summary: The autobiography of Booker T. Washington, former slave and founder of the Tuskegee Institute.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: The Wonderful Adventures of Nils
books.author: Selma Lagerlöf
books.summary: Nils Holgersson, transformed to an elf, learns the meaning of kindness during his adventures with a flock of wild geese.

books.title: Right Ho, Jeeves
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Bertie Wooster and his valet Jeeves try their hand at matchmaking in upper-class England.

books.title: Henry VI, Part II
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: King Henry VI marries Margaret of Anjou and further stokes discord within his court.

books.title: The Charwoman’s Shadow
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: A young nobleman becomes a magician to secure his sister’s marriage.

books.title: The Country of the Pointed Firs
books.author: Sarah Orne Jewett
books.summary: A series of sketches of a writer’s life in a small fishing village in Maine.

books.title: The Vampire
books.author: John William Polidori
books.summary: A London gentleman goes on an ill-fated trip with a mysterious and sinister newcomer.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.

books.title: File No. 113
books.author: Émile Gaboriau
books.summary: A bank is robbed and only two men appear to have the means to have done it; Monsieur Lecoq must discern if it was one of them or an “impossible” third party.

books.title: Commentaries on the Gallic War
books.author: Julius Caesar
books.summary: Julius Caesar’s account of the conflicts between Rome and Gaul in the later years of the Roman republic.

books.title: Liberalism
books.author: L. T. Hobhouse
books.summary: An early twentieth century description of the philosophy of liberal socialism.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: W. B. Yeats
books.summary: A collection of poems by W. B. Yeats.

books.title: Main Street
books.author: Sinclair Lewis
books.summary: An ambitious young woman chafes against the constraints of small-town America.

books.title: The Survivors
books.author: Tom Godwin
books.summary: A group of humans stranded on a deadly planet try to survive the harsh conditions and take revenge on the aliens that left them there.

books.title: The Law of the Four Just Men
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A group of wealthy vigilantes continue their quest to bring justice to those criminals beyond the reach of conventional law.

books.title: Unspoken Sermons
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: George MacDonald presents a set of interlocking sermons designed to shape the perception and life of the Christian disciple.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.
